channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for PA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for PA

item.title: Report X-2023081771
item.description:
Report X-2023081771

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-31T21:11:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-25
  • City: ALTOONA
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: NORFOLK SOUTHERN RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: NS personnel found tank car TILX190603 leaking small amount of product under movement. Upon inspection by a contractor, the leak was the result of a misaligned manway gasket. The gasket was replaced and the manway was properly secured..

item.title: Report X-2023080664
item.description:
Report X-2023080664

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-31T21:11:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-01
  • City: PITTSTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Discovered wet package while unloading a trailer on the floor of trailer. QA was notified and it was placed in hazmat lined tote. Trailer was dry inside. DescribePack: 2 gallons in box both of which had loose caps. 1/2 of 1 gallon spilled out saturating outer box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Loose caps - leaking containers in lined tote.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was being unloaded from the trailer and was found wet and leaked onto another package. QA collected the damages and took the to the hazmat cage. DescribePack: The seal of the plastic bottle is leaking. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: QA collected the damages and took them to the hazmat cage and cleaned up the spill.

item.title: Report X-2023080558
item.description:
Report X-2023080558

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-01
  • City: BREINIGSVILLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023080558 SequenceEvent: Package was processed and being delivered to Outbounds, Load Area 1. A few minutes later, manager explained to me box was leaking powder. Box was not leaking beforehand. Probable cause of leakage could be mishandling of package by package handler. No damages to outer packaging. Cleaned up area by sweeping up powder substance into the QA bin with the damaged hazmat in bin as well. DescribePack: Lid of Inner packaging was loose and seemed to be the source of leakage. Location of the loose end was the back of the package. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Checked to see if all openings were closed and package was standing upright. 2. X-2023080636 SequenceEvent: Package was found in outbounds by management leaking the substance. DOT hazmat label was located on the package and QA was called. QA contained spill and placed package in hazmat tote. DescribePack: Package had loose lid causing contents to spill out DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Substance was contained and package was placed in hazmat tote

  • State: PA

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one of the poly 5 gallon jug of hydrochloric asci (un1789) had been damaged by a sharp object and had released 1 gallon of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

item.title: Report X-2023080530
item.description:
Report X-2023080530

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-30
  • City: NORTHAMPTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Found the damaged hazmat upside-down on the hazmat pallet in QA. I grabbed my PPE and the hazardous material only bin to inspect the box. Each of the bottles were sealed in individual bags. DescribePack: As I turn each of the bottles up right, I noticed only one bottle liquid level was shorter than the others. I tried to turn it to the side to see where the leak was coming from. It came from the cap, it leaked when I turned the bottle to the side. DurationRel: 48 and MitigateEffect: When the hazmat first came to QA, it should have been turned upright to prevent more leakage.

item.title: Report X-2023080525
item.description:
Report X-2023080525

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-30
  • City: BREINIGSVILLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was unmarked and unlabeled as a Hazmat. Package went up the overhead sorter and broke open. This caused one bottle to spill on the belts. Facer noticed the open package and pulled it off on the singulator. QA and Management was called over due to strong fumes and inhalation of said fumes by the Facer. Package was secured in Hazardous Materials bags to prevent further leakage and fume inhalation. DescribePack: Due to breaking open on the belt, the bottle's cap had become loose. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package and empty bottle were secured in Hazardous Materials bags.

item.title: Report X-2023080521
item.description:
Report X-2023080521

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-28
  • City: BREINIGSVILLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package came out of the unload and went over the overhead sorters. This caused the package to be diverted down a chute, causing one of the container caps to be cracked resulting in a leak. QA recovered package and placed it inside a bin. DescribePack: One of caps for the bottles cracked, resulting in a leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was recovered from the outbounds, placed in a bin, and placed spill powder over the spill.

The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report E-2023080258
item.description:
Report E-2023080258

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-12
  • City: GREENCASTLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XHG experienced a UN1789 J.T. Baker Hydrochloric Acid, SN Volumetric Solution release from (2) 5-gallon poly jugs. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released impacting a 5' x 6" area of the trailer floor due to punctures caused by a load shift. Lye was utilized to neutralize the impacted area and absorbents were deployed and worked in to collect all liquid. The damaged jug and cleanup debris were collected and containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.
